projectPurpose: To provide an open-source, modular framework for building highly customizable and scalable application-specific blockchains (appchains) using Zero-Knowledge (ZK) Rollup technology, specifically within or integrating with the Starknet ecosystem, leveraging Cairo and Substrate.
mainFeatures: Modular ZK Rollup framework
Built using Cairo and Starknet technology
Allows building appchains (L2/L3)
Leverages Substrate framework for modularity and flexibility
Facilitates settlement to Ethereum or Starknet
Fully open source and customizable
High-performance Starknet sequencer
Supports JSON-RPC methods

alternatives.name: Polygon CDK
mainFeatures: Modular toolkit for ZK-powered L2 chains
Supports rollup and validium configurations
Aims for interoperability within Polygon ecosystem
Utilizes ZK technology for security and finality
Customizable features (gas tokens, DA solutions)

alternatives.name: ZK Stack
mainFeatures: Modular framework for sovereign ZK-powered Ethereum rollups
Based on zkSync Era code
Offers sovereignty and seamless connectivity via hyperbridges
Supports customizable aspects (DA layers, gas tokens)
Includes zkEVM and node services

alternatives.name: OP Stack
mainFeatures: Modular development stack for L2 ecosystems
Powers Optimism and the Superchain
Provides components for execution, DA, and sequencing
Supports custom gas tokens and DA layers (Plasma Mode)
Focuses on a shared, open-source system for rollups

alternatives.name: Sovereign SDK
mainFeatures: Toolkit for building scalable and interoperable rollups (ZK/Optimistic)
Defines a minimal Rollup Interface
Aims for clean separation of concerns
Includes a module system and full node
Supports adapters for different DA layers and zkVMs

alternatives.name: Arbitrum Orbit
mainFeatures: Allows launching customizable Layer 3 chains
Settles to Arbitrum Layer 2 chains
Provides flexibility in design choices
Integrates within the Arbitrum ecosystem

marketPositioning: Madara is an official, open-source implementation of the SN Stack, designed as a highly modular ZK Rollup framework for building customizable appchains. It leverages Starknet's core technologies, including the Cairo VM and STARK proofs, providing a powerful engine for creating provable programs and scalable infrastructure. Built on the Substrate framework, Madara offers exceptional modularity and flexibility, allowing developers to configure key components such as consensus mechanisms, data availability layers, and execution environments. Madara enables the deployment of appchains that can settle to either Ethereum or Starknet, facilitating Layer 2 and Layer 3 scaling solutions. Its open-source nature encourages customization and community contributions, positioning it as a leading choice for developers seeking to build application-specific blockchains deeply integrated with or extending the Starknet ecosystem, while also offering potential interoperability with other Substrate-based chains. Madara is recognized as a high-performance Starknet sequencer, optimized for developer experience and supporting the full range of Starknet JSON-RPC methods alongside its own custom extensions.
